e="preserve">Viktor Soczava (7 (20) June 1905, Pargolovo - December 29, 1978, Komarovo) was a Soviet geographer, geobotanist and landscape scientist, member of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR (1968), the founder of the Siberian Geographic School, the creator of a new direction in geographical science - the doctrine of geosystems.
He worked as a landscape scientist and was the founder of the Siberian School of Geography, having proposed the geosystem theory as a reformulation of the landscape theories of Lev S. Berg, Humboldt and Vasily Dokuchaev on the basis of the general systems theory
Works.
SOCZAVA, V.B. Por uma Teoria de classificação de geossistemas da vida terrestre. Biogeografia, n.14. IGUSP. São Paulo. 1978. 23 p.
